articles.title: Huge Trove of Nude Images Leaked by AI Image Generator Startup’s Exposed Database
articles.description: An AI image generator startup’s database was left accessible to the open internet, revealing more than 1 million images and videos, including photos of real people who had been “nudified.”

articles.title: Stars come out in Washington today as FIFA holds 2026 World Cup draw
articles.description: Canada finally gets to learn today who it will face at next summer’s World Cup. The road map for the expanded 48-team tournament will unfold at the draw in Washington, D.C. A star-studded crowd, including Prime Minister Mark Carney, U.S. President Donald Trump and Mexican President Claudia She

articles.title: Next gen cancer drug shows surprising anti aging power
articles.description: A next-generation drug tested in yeast was found to extend lifespan and slow aging by influencing a major growth-control pathway. Researchers also uncovered an unexpected role for agmatinases, enzymes that help keep this pathway in balance. Diet and gut microbes may affect aging more than expected b

articles.description: IndiGo, India's largest carrier, has said operations will return to full normalcy only by 10 February.

articles.title: Scientists reveal a powerful heart boost hidden in everyday foods
articles.description: Regular consumption of polyphenol-rich foods like tea, coffee, berries, nuts, and whole grains may significantly support long-term heart health. articles.title: Ottawa's most prolific art collector gave it all away, thinking he'd be dead by now
articles.description: When Bill Staubi was diagnosed with Stage-4 liver cancer, he divested himself of his massive art collection. Then the cancer disappeared.

articles.title: Former Alberta premier Jason Kenney says politician recall legislation being misused
articles.description: CALGARY — The architect of Alberta’s politician recall legislation says it was never meant to be used as a political weapon, but as an “ultimate tool of accountability” if a politician engages in illegal or unethical behaviour. Jason Kenney gave the remarks in an interview Thursday
